041package org.jfree.chart.plot;
042
043import java.awt.AlphaComposite;
044import java.awt.BasicStroke;
045import java.awt.Color;
046import java.awt.Composite;
047import java.awt.Font;
048import java.awt.FontMetrics;
049import java.awt.Graphics2D;
050import java.awt.Paint;
051import java.awt.Polygon;
052import java.awt.Shape;
053import java.awt.Stroke;
054import java.awt.geom.Arc2D;
055import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
056import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
057import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
058import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
059import java.io.IOException;
060import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
061import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
062import java.io.Serializable;
063import java.text.NumberFormat;
064import java.util.ArrayList;
065import java.util.Collections;
066import java.util.List;
067import java.util.Objects;

071import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItemCollection;
072import org.jfree.chart.event.PlotChangeEvent;

082
083/**
084 * A plot that displays a single value in the form of a needle on a dial.
085 * Defined ranges (for example, 'normal', 'warning' and 'critical') can be
086 * highlighted on the dial.
087 */
088public class MeterPlot extends Plot implements Serializable, Cloneable {
089
090    private MeterPlotProduct2 meterPlotProduct2 = new MeterPlotProduct2();
091
092        private MeterPlotProduct meterPlotProduct = new MeterPlotProduct();
093
094        /** For serialization. */
095    private static final long serialVersionUID = 2987472457734470962L;
096
097    /** The default background paint. */
098    static final Paint DEFAULT_DIAL_BACKGROUND_PAINT = Color.BLACK;
099
100    /** The default needle paint. */
101    static final Paint DEFAULT_NEEDLE_PAINT = Color.GREEN;
102
103    /** The default value font. */
104    static final Font DEFAULT_VALUE_FONT = new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 12);
105
106    /** The default value paint. */
107    static final Paint DEFAULT_VALUE_PAINT = Color.YELLOW;
108
109    /** The default meter angle. */
110    public static final int DEFAULT_METER_ANGLE = 270;
111
112    /** The default border size. */
113    public static final float DEFAULT_BORDER_SIZE = 3f;
114
115    /** The default circle size. */
116    public static final float DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE = 10f;
117
118    /** The default label font. */
119    public static final Font DEFAULT_LABEL_FONT = new Font("SansSerif",
120            Font.BOLD, 10);
121
122    /** The dataset (contains a single value). */
123    private ValueDataset dataset;
124
125    /** The tick size. */
126    private double tickSize;
127
128    /** The tick label format. */
129    private NumberFormat tickLabelFormat;
130
131    /** The resourceBundle for the localization. */
132    protected static ResourceBundle localizationResources
133            = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.jfree.chart.plot.LocalizationBundle");
134
135    /**
136     * A (possibly empty) list of the {@link MeterInterval}s to be highlighted
137     * on the dial.
138     */
139    private List<MeterInterval> intervals;
140
141    /**
142     * Creates a new plot with a default range of {@code 0} to {@code 100} and 
143     * no value to display.
144     */
145    public MeterPlot() {
146        this(null);
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Creates a new plot that displays the value from the supplied dataset.
151     *
152     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
153     */
154    public MeterPlot(ValueDataset dataset) {
155        super();
156        meterPlotProduct2.setShape(DialShape.CIRCLE);
157        meterPlotProduct2.setMeterAngle2(DEFAULT_METER_ANGLE);
158        meterPlotProduct2.setRange2(new Range(0.0, 100.0));
159        this.tickSize = 10.0;
160        meterPlotProduct.setTickPaint2(Color.WHITE);
161        meterPlotProduct.setUnits2("Units");
162        meterPlotProduct.setNeedlePaint2(MeterPlot.DEFAULT_NEEDLE_PAINT);
163        meterPlotProduct.setTickLabelsVisible2(true);
164        meterPlotProduct.setTickLabelFont2(MeterPlot.DEFAULT_LABEL_FONT);
165        meterPlotProduct.setTickLabelPaint2(Color.BLACK);
166        this.tickLabelFormat = NumberFormat.getInstance();
167        meterPlotProduct.setValueFont2(MeterPlot.DEFAULT_VALUE_FONT);
168        meterPlotProduct.setValuePaint2(MeterPlot.DEFAULT_VALUE_PAINT);
169        meterPlotProduct.setDialBackgroundPaint2(MeterPlot.DEFAULT_DIAL_BACKGROUND_PAINT);
170        this.intervals = new ArrayList<>();
171        setDataset(dataset);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Returns the dial shape.  The default is {@link DialShape#CIRCLE}).
176     *
177     * @return The dial shape (never {@code null}).
178     *
179     * @see #setDialShape(DialShape)
180     */
181    public DialShape getDialShape() {
182        return this.meterPlotProduct2.getShape();
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Sets the dial shape and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
187     * registered listeners.
188     *
189     * @param shape  the shape ({@code null} not permitted).
190     *
191     * @see #getDialShape()
192     */
193    public void setDialShape(DialShape shape) {
194        meterPlotProduct2.setDialShape(shape, this);
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Returns the meter angle in degrees.  This defines, in part, the shape
199     * of the dial.  The default is 270 degrees.
200     *
201     * @return The meter angle (in degrees).
202     *
203     * @see #setMeterAngle(int)
204     */
205    public int getMeterAngle() {
206        return this.meterPlotProduct2.getMeterAngle();
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Sets the angle (in degrees) for the whole range of the dial and sends
211     * a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
212     *
213     * @param angle  the angle (in degrees, in the range 1-360).
214     *
215     * @see #getMeterAngle()
216     */
217    public void setMeterAngle(int angle) {
218        meterPlotProduct2.setMeterAngle(angle, this);
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Returns the overall range for the dial.
223     *
224     * @return The overall range (never {@code null}).
225     *
226     * @see #setRange(Range)
227     */
228    public Range getRange() {
229        return this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange();
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Sets the range for the dial and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
234     * registered listeners.
235     *
236     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted and zero-length
237     *               ranges not permitted).
238     *
239     * @see #getRange()
240     */
241    public void setRange(Range range) {
242        meterPlotProduct2.setRange(range, this);
243    }
244
245    /**
246     * Returns the tick size (the interval between ticks on the dial).
247     *
248     * @return The tick size.
249     *
250     * @see #setTickSize(double)
251     */
252    public double getTickSize() {
253        return this.tickSize;
254    }
255
256    /**
257     * Sets the tick size and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
258     * registered listeners.
259     *
260     * @param size  the tick size (must be &gt; 0).
261     *
262     * @see #getTickSize()
263     */
264    public void setTickSize(double size) {
265        if (size <= 0) {
266            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Requires 'size' > 0.");
267        }
268        this.tickSize = size;
269        fireChangeEvent();
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Returns the paint used to draw the ticks around the dial.
274     *
275     * @return The paint used to draw the ticks around the dial (never
276     *         {@code null}).
277     *
278     * @see #setTickPaint(Paint)
279     */
280    public Paint getTickPaint() {
281        return this.meterPlotProduct.getTickPaint();
282    }
283
284    /**
285     * Sets the paint used to draw the tick labels around the dial and sends
286     * a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.

289     *
290     * @see #getTickPaint()
291     */
292    public void setTickPaint(Paint paint) {
293        meterPlotProduct.setTickPaint(paint, this);
294    }

579    /**
580     * Returns the dataset for the plot.
581     *
582     * @return The dataset (possibly {@code null}).
583     *
584     * @see #setDataset(ValueDataset)
585     */
586    public ValueDataset getDataset() {
587        return this.dataset;
588    }
589
590    /**
591     * Sets the dataset for the plot, replacing the existing dataset if there
592     * is one, and triggers a {@link PlotChangeEvent}.
593     *
594     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
595     *
596     * @see #getDataset()
597     */
598    public void setDataset(ValueDataset dataset) {
599
600        // if there is an existing dataset, remove the plot from the list of
601        // change listeners...
602        ValueDataset existing = this.dataset;
603        if (existing != null) {
604            existing.removeChangeListener(this);
605        }
606
607        // set the new dataset, and register the chart as a change listener...
608        this.dataset = dataset;
609        if (dataset != null) {
610            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
611        }
612
613        // send a dataset change event to self...
614        DatasetChangeEvent event = new DatasetChangeEvent(this, dataset);
615        datasetChanged(event);
616
617    }
618
619    /**
620     * Returns an unmodifiable list of the intervals for the plot.
621     *
622     * @return A list.
623     *
624     * @see #addInterval(MeterInterval)
625     */
626    public List<MeterInterval> getIntervals() {
627        return Collections.unmodifiableList(intervals);
628    }
629
630    /**
631     * Adds an interval and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered
632     * listeners.
633     *
634     * @param interval  the interval ({@code null} not permitted).
635     *
636     * @see #getIntervals()
637     * @see #clearIntervals()
638     */
639    public void addInterval(MeterInterval interval) {
640        Args.nullNotPermitted(interval, "interval");
641        intervals.add(interval);
642        fireChangeEvent();
643    }
644
645    /**
646     * Clears the intervals for the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
647     * all registered listeners.
648     *
649     * @see #addInterval(MeterInterval)
650     */
651    public void clearIntervals() {
652        intervals.clear();
653        fireChangeEvent();
654    }
655
656    /**
657     * Returns an item for each interval.
658     *
659     * @return A collection of legend items.
660     */
661    @Override
662    public LegendItemCollection getLegendItems() {
663        LegendItemCollection result = new LegendItemCollection();
664        for (MeterInterval mi : intervals) {
665            Paint color = mi.getBackgroundPaint();
666            if (color == null) {
667                color = mi.getOutlinePaint();
668            }
669            LegendItem item = new LegendItem(mi.getLabel(), mi.getLabel(),
670                    null, null, new Rectangle2D.Double(-4.0, -4.0, 8.0, 8.0),
671                    color);
672            item.setDataset(getDataset());
673            result.add(item);
674        }
675        return result;
676    }
677
678    /**
679     * Draws the plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
680     * printer).
681     *
682     * @param g2  the graphics device.
683     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
684     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
685     * @param parentState  the state from the parent plot, if there is one.
686     * @param info  collects info about the drawing.
687     */
688    @Override
689    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
690                     PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
691
692        if (info != null) {
693            info.setPlotArea(area);
694        }
695
696        // adjust for insets...
697        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
698        insets.trim(area);
699
700        area.setRect(area.getX() + 4, area.getY() + 4, area.getWidth() - 8,
701                area.getHeight() - 8);
702
703        // draw the background
704        if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getDrawBorder()) {
705            drawBackground(g2, area);
706        }
707
708        // adjust the plot area by the interior spacing value
709        double gapHorizontal = (2 * DEFAULT_BORDER_SIZE);
710        double gapVertical = (2 * DEFAULT_BORDER_SIZE);
711        double meterX = area.getX() + gapHorizontal / 2;
712        double meterY = area.getY() + gapVertical / 2;
713        double meterW = area.getWidth() - gapHorizontal;
714        double meterH = area.getHeight() - gapVertical
715                + ((this.meterPlotProduct2.getMeterAngle() <= 180) && (this.meterPlotProduct2.getShape() != DialShape.CIRCLE)
716                ? area.getHeight() / 1.25 : 0);
717
718        double min = Math.min(meterW, meterH) / 2;
719        meterX = (meterX + meterX + meterW) / 2 - min;
720        meterY = (meterY + meterY + meterH) / 2 - min;
721        meterW = 2 * min;
722        meterH = 2 * min;
723
724        Rectangle2D meterArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(meterX, meterY, meterW,
725                meterH);
726
727        Rectangle2D.Double originalArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(
728                meterArea.getX() - 4, meterArea.getY() - 4,
729                meterArea.getWidth() + 8, meterArea.getHeight() + 8);
730
731        double meterMiddleX = meterArea.getCenterX();
732        double meterMiddleY = meterArea.getCenterY();
733
734        // plot the data (unless the dataset is null)...
735        ValueDataset data = getDataset();
736        if (data != null) {
737            double dataMin = this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange().getLowerBound();
738            double dataMax = this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange().getUpperBound();
739
740            Shape savedClip = g2.getClip();
741            g2.clip(originalArea);
742            Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
743            g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
744                    getForegroundAlpha()));
745
746            if (this.meterPlotProduct.getDialBackgroundPaint() != null) {
747                meterPlotProduct2.fillArc(g2, originalArea, dataMin, dataMax,
748                        this.meterPlotProduct.getDialBackgroundPaint(), true);
749            }
750            drawTicks(g2, meterArea, dataMin, dataMax);
751            drawArcForInterval(g2, meterArea, new MeterInterval("", this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange(),
752                    this.meterPlotProduct.getDialOutlinePaint(), new BasicStroke(1.0f), null));
753
754            for (MeterInterval interval : this.intervals) {
755                drawArcForInterval(g2, meterArea, interval);
756            }
757
758            Number n = data.getValue();
759            if (n != null) {
760                double value = n.doubleValue();
761                drawValueLabel(g2, meterArea);
762
763                if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange().contains(value)) {
764                    g2.setPaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getNeedlePaint());
765                    g2.setStroke(new BasicStroke(2.0f));
766
767                    double radius = (meterArea.getWidth() / 2)
768                                    + DEFAULT_BORDER_SIZE + 15;
769                    double valueAngle = meterPlotProduct2.valueToAngle(value);
770                    double valueP1 = meterMiddleX
771                            + (radius * Math.cos(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
772                    double valueP2 = meterMiddleY
773                            - (radius * Math.sin(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
774
775                    Polygon arrow = new Polygon();
776                    if ((valueAngle > 135 && valueAngle < 225)
777                        || (valueAngle < 45 && valueAngle > -45)) {
778
779                        double valueP3 = (meterMiddleY
780                                - DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 4);
781                        double valueP4 = (meterMiddleY
782                                + DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 4);
783                        arrow.addPoint((int) meterMiddleX, (int) valueP3);
784                        arrow.addPoint((int) meterMiddleX, (int) valueP4);
785
786                    }
787                    else {
788                        arrow.addPoint((int) (meterMiddleX
789                                - DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 4), (int) meterMiddleY);
790                        arrow.addPoint((int) (meterMiddleX
791                                + DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 4), (int) meterMiddleY);
792                    }
793                    arrow.addPoint((int) valueP1, (int) valueP2);
794                    g2.fill(arrow);
795
796                    Ellipse2D circle = new Ellipse2D.Double(meterMiddleX
797                            - DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 2, meterMiddleY
798                            - DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE / 2, DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE,
799                            DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE);
800                    g2.fill(circle);
801                }
802            }
803
804            g2.setClip(savedClip);
805            g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
806
807        }
808        if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getDrawBorder()) {
809            drawOutline(g2, area);
810        }
811
812    }
813
814    /**
815     * Draws the arc to represent an interval.
816     *
817     * @param g2  the graphics device.
818     * @param meterArea  the drawing area.
819     * @param interval  the interval.
820     */
821    protected void drawArcForInterval(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D meterArea,
822                                      MeterInterval interval) {
823
824        double minValue = interval.getRange().getLowerBound();
825        double maxValue = interval.getRange().getUpperBound();
826        Paint outlinePaint = interval.getOutlinePaint();
827        Stroke outlineStroke = interval.getOutlineStroke();
828        Paint backgroundPaint = interval.getBackgroundPaint();
829
830        if (backgroundPaint != null) {
831            meterPlotProduct2.fillArc(g2, meterArea, minValue, maxValue, backgroundPaint, false);
832        }
833        if (outlinePaint != null) {
834            if (outlineStroke != null) {
835                drawArc(g2, meterArea, minValue, maxValue, outlinePaint,
836                        outlineStroke);
837            }
838            drawTick(g2, meterArea, minValue, true);
839            drawTick(g2, meterArea, maxValue, true);
840        }
841    }
842
843    /**
844     * Draws an arc.
845     *
846     * @param g2  the graphics device.
847     * @param area  the plot area.
848     * @param minValue  the minimum value.
849     * @param maxValue  the maximum value.
850     * @param paint  the paint.
851     * @param stroke  the stroke.
852     */
853    protected void drawArc(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, double minValue,
854                           double maxValue, Paint paint, Stroke stroke) {
855
856        double startAngle = meterPlotProduct2.valueToAngle(maxValue);
857        double endAngle = meterPlotProduct2.valueToAngle(minValue);
858        double extent = endAngle - startAngle;
859
860        double x = area.getX();
861        double y = area.getY();
862        double w = area.getWidth();
863        double h = area.getHeight();
864        g2.setPaint(paint);
865        g2.setStroke(stroke);
866
867        if (paint != null && stroke != null) {
868            Arc2D.Double arc = new Arc2D.Double(x, y, w, h, startAngle,
869                    extent, Arc2D.OPEN);
870            g2.setPaint(paint);
871            g2.setStroke(stroke);
872            g2.draw(arc);
873        }
874
875    }
876
877    /**
878     * Fills an arc on the dial between the given values.
879     *
880     * @param g2  the graphics device.
881     * @param area  the plot area.
882     * @param minValue  the minimum data value.
883     * @param maxValue  the maximum data value.
884     * @param paint  the background paint ({@code null} not permitted).
885     * @param dial  a flag that indicates whether the arc represents the whole
886     *              dial.
887     */
888    protected void fillArc(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area,
889            double minValue, double maxValue, Paint paint, boolean dial) {
890
891        meterPlotProduct2.fillArc(g2, area, minValue, maxValue, paint, dial);
892    }
893
894    /**
895     * Translates a data value to an angle on the dial.
896     *
897     * @param value  the value.
898     *
899     * @return The angle on the dial.
900     */
901    public double valueToAngle(double value) {
902        return meterPlotProduct2.valueToAngle(value);
903    }
904
905    /**
906     * Draws the ticks that subdivide the overall range.
907     *
908     * @param g2  the graphics device.
909     * @param meterArea  the meter area.
910     * @param minValue  the minimum value.
911     * @param maxValue  the maximum value.
912     */
913    protected void drawTicks(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D meterArea,
914                             double minValue, double maxValue) {
915        for (double v = minValue; v <= maxValue; v += this.tickSize) {
916            drawTick(g2, meterArea, v);
917        }
918    }
919
920    /**
921     * Draws a tick.
922     *
923     * @param g2  the graphics device.
924     * @param meterArea  the meter area.
925     * @param value  the value.
926     */
927    protected void drawTick(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D meterArea,
928            double value) {
929        drawTick(g2, meterArea, value, false);
930    }
931
932    /**
933     * Draws a tick on the dial.
934     *
935     * @param g2  the graphics device.
936     * @param meterArea  the meter area.
937     * @param value  the tick value.
938     * @param label  a flag that controls whether or not a value label is drawn.
939     */
940    protected void drawTick(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D meterArea,
941                            double value, boolean label) {
942
943        double valueAngle = meterPlotProduct2.valueToAngle(value);
944
945        double meterMiddleX = meterArea.getCenterX();
946        double meterMiddleY = meterArea.getCenterY();
947
948        g2.setPaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickPaint());
949        g2.setStroke(new BasicStroke(2.0f));
950
951        double valueP2X;
952        double valueP2Y;
953
954        double radius = (meterArea.getWidth() / 2) + DEFAULT_BORDER_SIZE;
955        double radius1 = radius - 15;
956
957        double valueP1X = meterMiddleX
958                + (radius * Math.cos(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
959        double valueP1Y = meterMiddleY
960                - (radius * Math.sin(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
961
962        valueP2X = meterMiddleX
963                + (radius1 * Math.cos(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
964        valueP2Y = meterMiddleY
965                - (radius1 * Math.sin(Math.PI * (valueAngle / 180)));
966
967        Line2D.Double line = new Line2D.Double(valueP1X, valueP1Y, valueP2X,
968                valueP2Y);
969        g2.draw(line);
970
971        if (this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelsVisible() && label) {
972
973            String tickLabel =  this.tickLabelFormat.format(value);
974            g2.setFont(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelFont());
975            g2.setPaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelPaint());
976
977            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics();
978            Rectangle2D tickLabelBounds
979                = TextUtils.getTextBounds(tickLabel, g2, fm);
980
981            double x = valueP2X;
982            double y = valueP2Y;
983            if (valueAngle == 90 || valueAngle == 270) {
984                x = x - tickLabelBounds.getWidth() / 2;
985            }
986            else if (valueAngle < 90 || valueAngle > 270) {
987                x = x - tickLabelBounds.getWidth();
988            }
989            if ((valueAngle > 135 && valueAngle < 225)
990                    || valueAngle > 315 || valueAngle < 45) {
991                y = y - tickLabelBounds.getHeight() / 2;
992            }
993            else {
994                y = y + tickLabelBounds.getHeight() / 2;
995            }
996            g2.drawString(tickLabel, (float) x, (float) y);
997        }
998    }
999
1000    /**
1001     * Draws the value label just below the center of the dial.
1002     *
1003     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1004     * @param area  the plot area.
1005     */
1006    protected void drawValueLabel(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
1007        if (meterPlotProduct.getValueVisible()) {
1008            g2.setFont(this.meterPlotProduct.getValueFont());
1009            g2.setPaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getValuePaint());
1010            String valueStr = "No value";
1011            if (this.dataset != null) {
1012                Number n = this.dataset.getValue();
1013                if (n != null) {
1014                    valueStr = this.tickLabelFormat.format(n.doubleValue()) + " "
1015                        + this.meterPlotProduct.getUnits();
1016                }
1017            }
1018            float x = (float) area.getCenterX();
1019            float y = (float) area.getCenterY() + DEFAULT_CIRCLE_SIZE;
1020            TextUtils.drawAlignedString(valueStr, g2, x, y,
1021                TextAnchor.TOP_CENTER);
1022        }
1023    }
1024
1025    /**
1026     * Returns a short string describing the type of plot.
1027     *
1028     * @return A string describing the type of plot.
1029     */
1030    @Override
1031    public String getPlotType() {
1032        return localizationResources.getString("Meter_Plot");
1033    }
1034
1035    /**
1036     * A zoom method that does nothing.  Plots are required to support the
1037     * zoom operation.  In the case of a meter plot, it doesn't make sense to
1038     * zoom in or out, so the method is empty.
1039     *
1040     * @param percent   The zoom percentage.
1041     */
1042    @Override
1043    public void zoom(double percent) {
1044        // intentionally blank
1045    }
1046
1047    /**
1048     * Tests the plot for equality with an arbitrary object.  Note that the
1049     * dataset is ignored for the purposes of testing equality.
1050     *
1051     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1052     *
1053     * @return A boolean.
1054     */
1055    @Override
1056    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1057        if (obj == this) {
1058            return true;
1059        }
1060        if (!(obj instanceof MeterPlot)) {
1061            return false;
1062        }
1063        if (!super.equals(obj)) {
1064            return false;
1065        }
1066        MeterPlot that = (MeterPlot) obj;
1067        if (!Objects.equals(this.meterPlotProduct.getUnits(), that.meterPlotProduct.getUnits())) {
1068            return false;
1069        }
1070        if (!Objects.equals(this.meterPlotProduct2.getRange(), that.meterPlotProduct2.getRange())) {
1071            return false;
1072        }
1073        if (!Objects.equals(this.intervals, that.intervals)) {
1074            return false;
1075        }
1076        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getDialOutlinePaint(),
1077                that.meterPlotProduct.getDialOutlinePaint())) {
1078            return false;
1079        }
1080        if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getShape() != that.meterPlotProduct2.getShape()) {
1081            return false;
1082        }
1083        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getDialBackgroundPaint(),
1084                that.meterPlotProduct.getDialBackgroundPaint())) {
1085            return false;
1086        }
1087        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getNeedlePaint(), that.meterPlotProduct.getNeedlePaint())) {
1088            return false;
1089        }
1090        if (this.meterPlotProduct.getValueVisible() != that.meterPlotProduct.getValueVisible()) {
1091            return false;
1092        }
1093        if (!Objects.equals(this.meterPlotProduct.getValueFont(), that.meterPlotProduct.getValueFont())) {
1094            return false;
1095        }
1096        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getValuePaint(), that.meterPlotProduct.getValuePaint())) {
1097            return false;
1098        }
1099        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickPaint(), that.meterPlotProduct.getTickPaint())) {
1100            return false;
1101        }
1102        if (this.tickSize != that.tickSize) {
1103            return false;
1104        }
1105        if (this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelsVisible() != that.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelsVisible()) {
1106            return false;
1107        }
1108        if (!Objects.equals(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelFont(), that.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelFont())) {
1109            return false;
1110        }
1111        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelPaint(), that.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelPaint())) {
1112            return false;
1113        }
1114        if (!Objects.equals(this.tickLabelFormat, that.tickLabelFormat)) {
1115            return false;
1116        }
1117        if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getDrawBorder() != that.meterPlotProduct2.getDrawBorder()) {
1118            return false;
1119        }
1120        if (this.meterPlotProduct2.getMeterAngle() != that.meterPlotProduct2.getMeterAngle()) {
1121            return false;
1122        }
1123        return true;
1124    }
1125
1126    /**
1127     * Provides serialization support.
1128     *
1129     * @param stream  the output stream.
1130     *
1131     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1132     */
1133    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1134        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1135        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getDialBackgroundPaint(), stream);
1136        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getDialOutlinePaint(), stream);
1137        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getNeedlePaint(), stream);
1138        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getValuePaint(), stream);
1139        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickPaint(), stream);
1140        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.meterPlotProduct.getTickLabelPaint(), stream);
1141    }
1142
1143    /**
1144     * Provides serialization support.
1145     *
1146     * @param stream  the input stream.
1147     *
1148     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1149     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1150     */
1151    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1152        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1153        stream.defaultReadObject();
1154        meterPlotProduct.setDialBackgroundPaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1155        meterPlotProduct.setDialOutlinePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1156        meterPlotProduct.setNeedlePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1157        meterPlotProduct.setValuePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1158        meterPlotProduct.setTickPaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1159        meterPlotProduct.setTickLabelPaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1160        if (this.dataset != null) {
1161            this.dataset.addChangeListener(this);
1162        }
1163    }
1164
1165    /**
1166     * Returns an independent copy (clone) of the plot.  The dataset is NOT
1167     * cloned - both the original and the clone will have a reference to the
1168     * same dataset.
1169     *
1170     * @return A clone.
1171     *
1172     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if some component of the plot cannot
1173     *         be cloned.
1174     */
1175    @Override
1176    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1177        MeterPlot clone = (MeterPlot) super.clone();
1178                clone.meterPlotProduct2 = (MeterPlotProduct2) this.meterPlotProduct2.clone();
1179                clone.meterPlotProduct = (MeterPlotProduct) this.meterPlotProduct.clone();
1180        clone.tickLabelFormat = (NumberFormat) this.tickLabelFormat.clone();
1181        // the following relies on the fact that the intervals are immutable
1182        clone.intervals = new ArrayList<>(this.intervals);
1183        if (clone.dataset != null) {
1184            clone.dataset.addChangeListener(clone);
1185        }
1186        return clone;
1187    }
1188
1189}
